data.title: Buffers are write-only on ES 2.0
data.body: Issue #1127 raised the problem of trying to read data from vertex buffers.  Turns out the GL_OES_mapbuffer extension is write-only. Therefore I have added NotSupportedException to VertexBuffer.GetData() and IndexBuffer.GetData() for ES platforms.

data.title: Apply params correctly for effects using same shader
data.body:
Fix for issue #1116
If two effects were using the same shader, the constant buffer would not be applied when each effect was used.

data.title: [ANDROID] Issue with meshPart.VertexBuffer.GetData<float>(vertexData)
(Android) After resume causing window death
data.body:
I have been testing Android 4.x using the "previous apps" button to push the game to the background. So what I do is run the game, move through the windows, then press the previous apps button. From the previous apps list, I choose Santa Shooter and MonoGame runs through the content bootstrap sequence. Sometimes it works, sometimes not. When it doesn't work, the game immediately ends and the output has:

12-29 21:07:59.393 I/mono-stdout(24690): Game is loading content. (Game.LoadContent)
-> update <- Game.LoadContent completes without any errors (it is empty)

12-29 21:07:59.593 I/ActivityManager(  453): Process SantaShooter.SantaShooter (pid 24690) has died.
12-29 21:07:59.593 W/InputDispatcher(  453): channel '423c7b38 SantaShooter.SantaShooter/totallyevil.santashooter2d.SantaShooter (server)' ~ Consumer closed input channel or an error occurred.  events=0x9
12-29 21:07:59.593 E/InputDispatcher(  453): channel '423c7b38 SantaShooter.SantaShooter/totallyevil.santashooter2d.SantaShooter (server)' ~ Channel is unrecoverably broken and will be disposed!
12-29 21:07:59.593 W/ActivityManager(  453): Force removing ActivityRecord{41dc69c0 u0 SantaShooter.SantaShooter/totallyevil.santashooter2d.SantaShooter}: app died, no saved state
12-29 21:07:59.603 W/InputDispatcher(  453): Attempted to unregister already unregistered input channel '423c7b38 SantaShooter.SantaShooter/totallyevil.santashooter2d.SantaShooter (server)'

data.title: Implement GetData() for IndexBuffer & VertexBuffer on WinRT
data.body:
It's quite common to use the standard importers to get a Model and then
use a GetData()  in order to read the Vertices/Indices and manipulate
them.
I use some  code from SharpDX.Toolkit as quide.
In short one has to copy the static VertexBuffer into a temporary buffer
which we can then read.

data.title: Attempting to create less Action objects when unnecessary.
data.body: This is the same pull request as https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/1115 with the specific fix cherry picked into it's own branch to preserve history.

data.title: [iOS] Disappearing SoundEffects
data.body:
There is one thing with the iOS version of MonoGame that always annoyed me and I never really knew why it happened: SoundEffects randomly disappear.

We have a dozen of sound effects in our game, loaded using a single content manager. There are a number of instances created from every effect. When the game is launched, some of the sound effects won't play. For example, I launch the game and the "Click" sound doesn't play (all the instances of it). Then I close it, launch it again and the "Bell" sound doesn't play. Sometimes multiple effects disappear, sometimes none of them.

It may or may not be related, but when the game loads, I get a number of these on the application output:

```
Failed to get buffer attributes: 
```

It seems that I don't get any of these when all the sound effects work, but I get many of some of them don't.

data.title: Added SoundEffect.FromStream
data.body:
Hey,
This is my first pull request, so please be gentle.

I came across this function in the xna docs and it looked like it was for me, so i implemented it here as it as i needed it to test on Android with as well.

The only platforms i tested with were Windows7 and Android 2.3

data.title: Add missing 'vertexStride' parameter to DynamicVertexBuffer.SetData
data.body:
Add missing 'vertexStride' parameter to DynamicVertexBuffer.SetData(...)
method.
See: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb975971.aspx

Rename similar protected method on base class VertexBuffer to avoid
conflict.
protected void SetData(...) -> protected void SetDataInternal(...)

Fix call to the previously wrong method inside GraphicsDevice.

data.title: Nkast2branch
data.body:
-Add missing SetData() to DynamicVertexBuffer.
-Implement GetData() to VertexBuffer & IndexBuffer

data.title: Add missing SetData(...) method to DynamicVertexBuffer
data.body:
A method that lets you set both vertexStride & options was missing.
See: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb975971.aspx

I use 'new' because the same method is defined in base class VertexBuffer as protected. It is a helping method that shouldn't be exposed by VertexBuffer.
Another way would be to rename the helping method in VertexBuffer so that the two methods would not conflict.

data.title: Unify Names for iOS Assemblies.
data.body:
A bit of discussion started here: http://monogame.codeplex.com/discussions/406722

The simulator's assembly is named "MonoGame.Framework.iOS" while the device assembly is "MonoGame.Framework". These need to be unified. As per the discussion, I dropped the platform name from all configurations.

data.title: Switching GL float precision from highp to mediump.
data.body:
There's enough discussion on this topic in https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/1090, https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/1030, and https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/909 so I'll refer to those.

Long story short, shader precision for our floats were defaulting to highp, which is a full 16 bits. Lowering this to 10 bits offers a pretty large performance win when drawing sprites. Our game saw about 3-6FPS on our main menu, but other have reported as high as 20.

Should developers really want high precision floats in their shaders, they're more than free to recompile for highp. Defaulting to mediump returns us closer to the performance people desired from MonoGame 2.0 and GLES 1.1.

data.title: BasicEffect state matrix bug (Linux)
iOS threading improvement
data.body:
After some profiling, I noticed some overhead in our SetData calls for IBs and especially VB's. After some poking around, I found out that us allocating a new Action object every call was part of the problem. We only need to create an action object and pass it through the threading functions if we're not on the UI thread. I moved the internals of these calls into their own functions, and call them directly if we're on the correct thread. Our game saw a 2-4FPS performance boost from this alone.

If there's a more elegant solution, I'm all ears. I'm not in love with calling IsOnUiThread() twice now.

I know @slygamer worked with most of the threading stuff, so it'd be valuable to get his input on this.

data.title: Disable smoothing
data.body:
Hi,

I develop pixel art game. How I can full disable smoothing/antialiasing for textures in last version of MonoGame?
I tried code:

``` cs
spriteBatch.Begin(SpriteSortMode.Deferred, BlendState.AlphaBlend, 
    SamplerState.PointClamp, DepthStencilState.None, RasterizerState.CullNone);
```

but it worked on XNA and not worked on MonoGame

data.title: New VS2010 Content Project Template
data.body:
This is a new VS2010 content project template which includes both the dummy builder project and the content project itself.

A few other details in here...
- The XNA content assemblies are not tied to a version anymore.
- The content builder project is now a Library.
- Content project no longer creates Release/Debug folders.
- Fixed the hard coded ProjectGuid in the content project.
- Added PSM support.

data.title: Null reference exception on Linux during OpenTKGameWindow.Initialize()
data.body:
Using the latest develop3d branch on Ubuntu 12.04, I get a null reference exception when trying to start any of the samples:

```
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.OpenTKGameWindow.Initialize () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.OpenTKGameWindow..ctor () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.OpenTKGamePlatform..ctor (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game game) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GamePlatform.Create (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game game) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game..ctor () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at Microsoft.Xna.Samples.Draw2D.Game1..ctor () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at Microsoft.Xna.Samples.Draw2D.Program.Main () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
```

Digging into the code, the culprit is the following condition in OpenTKGameWindow.cs:

```
// Make the foreground context the current context
if (!GraphicsContext.CurrentContext.IsCurrent)
    window.MakeCurent();
```

The GraphicsContext.CurrentContext property returns null. I worked around the issue (though I have no idea if this is the appropriate fix) by changing it to:

```
// Make the foreground context the current context
IGraphicsContext currentContext = GraphicsContext.CurrentContext;

if (currentContext == null || !currentContext.IsCurrent)
    window.MakeCurrent();
```

After this change, the Draw2D sample runs properly.

data.title: Removing Old Content Project Templates
data.body: Removing the old content project templates which are no longer used.

data.title: GraphicsDevice.DrawIndexedPrimitives on iOS
Various WP8 fixes
data.body:
Added BackButton support (with exit)

Modified template to support back button
Moved game creation in template after load to correctly set the size (if
created earlier, width and height are set to 0 resulting in infinite touch locations among others)

Don't start playing a SoundEffectInstance if it's playing (this was an issue on Windows 8 too)

Added support for music playback on WP8 
Fixed PlayPosition on Windows 8

data.title: Various WP8 fixes
data.body:
Added dispatcher for MediaPlayer (still doesn't work due to SharpDX)
Added initial BackButton support

Modified template to support back button
Moved game creation in template after load to correctly set the size (if
created earlier, width and height are set to 0)

data.title: No 16 bit RenderTargets on WP8/W8
data.body: When trying to create 16 bit (4444) rendertargets on Windows 8 or WP8, SharpDX throws an exception (invalid parameter). Is it not supported by SharpDX or does it need a change in MonoGame?

data.title: Wrong FullName for ContentTypeReader
data.body:
ContentTypeReaderManager.PrepareType(string type) return wrong full type name for ContentTypeReader.

After execute line 202
preparedType = preparedType.Replace(", Microsoft.Xna.Framework", string.Format(", {0}", assemblyName));

full type name equal

 "Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Texture2DReader, Microsoft.Xna.Framework, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null"

"Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null" REPEATED.

After remove this line from PrepareType function everything is working properly.
